wikipedia_page.main:
James Hendry, GC (20 December 1911 – 13 June 1941) was a Canadian corporal who was posthumously awarded the George Cross for gallantry and self-sacrifice displayed on 13 June 1941 while attempting to extinguish a fire in an explosives store.
Hendry was born in Falkirk, Scotland on 20 December 1911 to parents John and Janet Hendry.  The family lived in Geraldton, Ontario before the war with several working in the local gold mines.

response: *James Hendry, soldier and recipient of the George Cross
* James Hendry (obstetrician) (1885–1945), Regius Professor of Midwifery at the University of Glasgow
* James Hendry (moderator) (1852-1927) Moderator of the General Assembly of the Free Church of Scotland 1909
